in between: past perfect tense (past action is complete)

To not do something (more formal than 못)
like, similar to (hint: starts with ㅊ)
like, similar to (hint: starts with ㄱ)
answer sheet (for a student taking test)

to quit (e.g., smoking); to end (e.g., subscription)
to be over, or more than
You've been playing computer games for over 5 hours. (~ㄴ 지)
Tteokbokki is spicy, so I really can't eat it.
to boil; to make stew, soup
There are so many people that you need to reserve it in advance.

it looks like it is (present tense)
it looks like it will (future tense)
